block.p: Sarah Cain Fortune, a daughter of Sheila and Philip J. Fortune of Morristown, N.J., was married there yesterday to Christopher Bernhard Langhart, a son of Marlene and Bernhard Langhart of East Northport, N.Y. Msgr. Martin Rauscher performed the ceremony at the Church of the Assumption.

Mrs. Fortune-Langhart, 29, is a regional manager at Empire Blue Cross and Blue Shield in New York, where she oversees the enrollment of doctors. She graduated from Boston College. Her father works in New York as the eastern divisional manager and vice president for sales for Buena Vista Pictures, the theatrical distribution unit of the Walt Disney Company. Her mother is a nurse assistant in Hackettstown, N.J., for Pulmonary and Allergy Associates.

Sarah Cain Fortune, a daughter of Sheila and Philip J. Fortune of Morristown, N.J., was married there yesterday to Christopher Bernhard Langhart, a son of Marlene and Bernhard Langhart of East Northport, N.Y. Msgr. Martin Rauscher performed the ceremony at the Church of the Assumption.

Mrs. Fortune-Langhart, 29, is a regional manager at Empire Blue Cross and Blue Shield in New York, where she oversees the enrollment of doctors. She graduated from Boston College. Her father works in New York as the eastern divisional manager and vice president for sales for Buena Vista Pictures, the theatrical distribution unit of the Walt Disney Company. Her mother is a nurse assistant in Hackettstown, N.J., for Pulmonary and Allergy Associates.

Mr. Langhart, 34, is an associate at Hawkins, Delafield & Wood, a law firm in New York. He graduated from the State University at Albany and the Pace University School of Law. His father is a product manager for Russon Consolidated Industries, an importer of machine tools in North Smithfield, R.I.
